pr_title: KEYCLOAK-16584 KEYCLOAK-16118 Align map storage to no downtime master

timeline.bodyText:
Will there remain both KEYCLOAK-16584 and KEYCLOAK-16118 commits?
It seems to me (and I might be wrong :) ) ModelCriteriaBuilder should rather belong to KEYCLOAK-16118 commit than to this one. But it'd mean to move all related code there so I'm not sure if it's worth it, wdyt?
timeline.author: vramik
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,176 @@ +/* + * Copyright 2020 Red Hat, Inc. and/or its affiliates + * and other contributors as indicated by the @author tags. + * + * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); + * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. + * You may obtain a copy of the License at + * + * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 + * + * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software + * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, + * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. + * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and + * limitations under the License. + */ +package org.keycloak.models.map.storage; + +import org.keycloak.storage.SearchableModelField; + +/** + * Builder for criteria that can be used to limit results obtained from the store. + * This class is used for similar purpose as e.g. JPA's {@code CriteriaBuilder}, + * however it is much simpler version as it is tailored to very specific needs + * of future Keycloak store. + *

+ * Implementations are expected to be immutable. The expected use is like this: + * 

+ * cb = storage.getCriteriaBuilder();
+ * storage.read(
+ *   cb.or(
+ *     cb.compare(FIELD1, EQ, 1).compare(FIELD2, EQ, 2),
+ *     cb.compare(FIELD1, EQ, 3).compare(FIELD2, EQ, 4)
+ *   )
+ * );
+ *
+ * The above code should read items where + * {@code (FIELD1 == 1 && FIELD2 == 2) || (FIELD1 == 3 && FIELD2 == 4)}. + * + *

+ * It is equivalent to this: + * 

+ * cb = storage.getCriteriaBuilder();
+ * storage.read(
+ *   cb.or(
+ *     cb.and(cb.compare(FIELD1, EQ, 1), cb.compare(FIELD2, EQ, 2)),
+ *     cb.and(cb.compare(FIELD1, EQ, 3), cb.compare(FIELD2, EQ, 4))
+ *   )
+ * );
+ *
+ * + * @author hmlnarik + */ +public interface ModelCriteriaBuilder {

replies.bodyText: This is exactly the concern, the boundary is blurred here. I'd prefer to keep it as is right now.
replies.author: hmlnarik

timeline.bodyText:
Do we need to update the year to 2021?
If so, there are other newly created classes or interfaces.
timeline.author: vramik
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,176 @@
+/*
+ * Copyright 2020 Red Hat, Inc. and/or its affiliates

timeline.bodyText: Really minor question. Do we need to add also @throws NullPointerException clause in case key is null? I've just noticed the clause is there for create, but not here, so I was wondering if it should't be "unified".
timeline.author: vramik

replies.bodyText: Yes. Since it this note is there though, I believe there was a race condition between some of my commits and the review
replies.author: hmlnarik

replies.bodyText: yup, it seems so, thank you
replies.author: vramik

timeline.bodyText:
It might be beneficial to add a javadoc for this method here as it's not overridden from MapStorage so when using it in the code there is no java-doc info what the method actually does, so it has to be seen from the code itself, while other methods has their description from MapStorage interface, wdyt?
To be honest I'm not sure why this particular method is not included in the interface. Maybe we could add it there?
timeline.author: vramik

replies.bodyText:
Good catch. This method should have been removed.
Reason for not including it in the interface is to remove easy way to read full database which is not desirable anywhere apart from test and development where it can be achieved via the existing read(ModelCriteriaBuilder) method.
replies.author: hmlnarik

timeline.bodyText: I miss the reason to have this parameters here as it seems to me those are not accessible via any methods. But maybe I'm overlooking something.
timeline.author: vramik

timeline.bodyText: Just a question, I've always seen classes which extends Exception or a subclass named with suffix "Exception". I'm not sure if it's a convention or a habit. Anyway I wanted to hear your opinion.

timeline.bodyText: Can you please explain the benefit using anonymous inner class here for me?
timeline.author: vramik

replies.bodyText: None in particular, could be lambda as well.
replies.author: hmlnarik

timeline.bodyText: nit: this check could be potentially moved to private method as it's used multiple times within this class, but I'm really ok with the way how it's now.
timeline.author: vramik

timeline.message:
KEYCLOAK-16118 Replace MapStorage.entrySet() with search by criteria

* Add model class parameter to MapStorage
* Add shortcut read(id) method to MapKeycloakTransaction

timeline.bodyText: Now the parameters are accessible, but the methods are not used anywhere. Do you plan to have a use for them?
timeline.author: vramik

replies.bodyText: They will likely be used in an exception converter
replies.author: hmlnarik

timeline.bodyText: Previously, realm was checked for null value, should we check it here as well?
timeline.author: mhajas

replies.bodyText: This check is now performed in tx.getUpdatedNotRemoved() which is the only place where null may appear. The set of returned values that were not touched in this transaction should never be null (since it would not satisfy the mcb filter in the first place).
replies.author: hmlnarik

replies.bodyText:
I mean realm.getId() will throw NPE when realm is null. However, I am not sure this makes sense to add now. We are not checking many other parameters. Maybe we should add it to cleanup task to either document that NPE may be thrown when null parameter is passed or do some checking everywhere.
I just wanted to point it out as this is change of behaviour in this PR. Before there was no user/group/role returned as ALWAYS_FALSE filter was used when realm was null.
replies.author: mhajas

replies.bodyText: I agree, this should have been there. Added https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KEYCLOAK-16872
replies.author: hmlnarik

timeline.bodyText: Should this be done using tx.getCount() instead getUpdatedNotRemoved()? Currently it is the same, however for JPA it could be faster using count query.
timeline.author: mhajas

timeline.bodyText: Should we add limit and start support to mcb? Or some other way into transaction/storage? Because if I recall correctly, the stream's skip/max is not ideal for JPA.
timeline.author: mhajas

replies.bodyText: I believe this is a good idea, thought I'm not convinced that ModelCriteriaBuilder should be the place to put it, as ModelCriteriaBuilder can be nested to a Boolean expressions via and, or and not operations that don't play well. Looks like the MapStorage.read variant would be a better fit? I've introduced https://issues.redhat.com/browse/KEYCLOAK-16855 to have a discussion there
replies.author: hmlnarik

timeline.bodyText: This construct is quite often repeating in each provider. Should we create some auxiliary function for it? Or maybe even create a function like createCriteriaBuilder(RealmModel)? The corresponding SearchableFields field could be hardcoded withing storage since it is always the same for each storage.
timeline.author: mhajas

replies.bodyText: I was thinking about it, I decided for a more explicit "WHERE clause" as it then shows exact condition in full and is still short enough. I'm open to change it if there is a convincing argument though
replies.author: hmlnarik

replies.bodyText: I see. Well I don't have any strong argument there, I just think that it would be worth adding as almost each entity we have is related to exactly one realm. But I agree with you, the code is more comprehensible this way, so we can leave it as is.
replies.author: mhajas

timeline.message:
KEYCLOAK-16584 Rename map to CRUD operations

* rename putIfAbsent() to create(), get() to read(), put() to update(), remove() to delete()
* move ConcurrentHashMapStorage to org.keycloak.models.map.storage.chm package
* Add javadoc to MapStorage

KEYCLOAK-16118 Replace MapStorage.entrySet() with search by criteria

* Add model class parameter to MapStorage
* Add shortcut read(id) method to MapKeycloakTransaction
